title: Ginger, chilli and lime steamed cod with stir-fried red cabbage and coriander rice
time: Hands-on time 30 min, oven time 10-12 minutes
description: This Asian-inspired cod recipe is perfect for a quick and easy midweek dinner. The best part? After cooking, there will be minimal washing up.
ingredients: 50g fresh ginger, thinly sliced (no need to peel)
Finely grated zest and juice 2 limes, plus lime wedges
2 x 250g packets cooked brown rice (we like Tilda)
Large bunch fresh coriander, roughly chopped
4 x 30cm circles of non-stick baking paper

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 190°C/170°C fan/gas 5. Slice each fish loin in half and put 2 pieces in the centre of each piece of baking paper. Add a few slices of ginger and chilli, a splash of lime juice and a lime wedge, then bring the baking paper edges together to make parcels. Seal by either stapling the edges or twisting, folding and pleating them. Put on a baking tray and bake for 10-12 minutes until the fish flakes easily.

method.Step 2: Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large pan. Add the rest of the ginger and chilli, the garlic and red cabbage. Stir-fry for 4-5 minutes to soften. Add the soy sauce, the cooked rice and the rest of the lime juice and zest, then stir-fry for 5 minutes until hot through. Add a splash of water if it sticks. Stir in the coriander, season and serve with the fish.
